description.zh-cn: 东汉末年至曹魏初期的重要谋臣，先后事奉袁绍、张杨、曹操、曹丕、曹叡，以权谋著称，官至司徒，封乐平侯。
description.en: An important strategist and official from the late Eastern Han Dynasty to the early Cao Wei period. He served Yuan Shao, Zhang Yang, Cao Cao, Cao Pi, and Cao Rui successively. Known for his schemes and strategies, he reached the position of Minister over the Masses (Situ) and was enfeoffed as the Marquis of Leping.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年的军阀，曾是北方最强大的势力之一。
description.en: A warlord in the late Eastern Han Dynasty, who was once one of the most powerful forces in northern China.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年的军阀，盘踞在河内郡。
description.en: A warlord in the late Eastern Han Dynasty, who occupied Henei Commandery.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年的政治家、军事家、文学家，曹魏政权的奠基者。
description.en: A statesman, general, and poet of the late Eastern Han Dynasty, and the founder of the Cao Wei state.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏的开国皇帝，曹操的次子。
description.en: The founding emperor of the Cao Wei state, and the second son of Cao Cao.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏的第二位皇帝，曹丕之子。
description.en: The second emperor of the Cao Wei state, and the son of Cao Pi.

description.zh-cn: 东汉时期的冀州刺史。
description.en: Inspector of Ji Province during the Eastern Han Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年的军阀，与袁绍争夺河北地区。
description.en: A warlord in the late Eastern Han Dynasty who contended with Yuan Shao for control of northern China.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年巨鹿郡的大姓，曾主谋作乱反抗袁绍势力。
description.en: A member of a prominent clan in Julu Commandery during the late Eastern Han Dynasty, who masterminded a rebellion against Yuan Shao's forces.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年的军阀，曾与曹操为友，后反叛。
description.en: A warlord in the late Eastern Han Dynasty, who was once an ally of Cao Cao before rebelling against him.

description.zh-cn: 东汉的最后一位皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Eastern Han Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年董卓的部将，董卓死后曾控制朝廷。
description.en: A general under the warlord Dong Zhuo in the late Eastern Han Dynasty, who controlled the imperial court after Dong Zhuo's death.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年董卓的部将，董卓死后曾控制朝廷。
description.en: A general under the warlord Dong Zhuo in the late Eastern Han Dynasty, who controlled the imperial court after Dong Zhuo's death.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年的将领，曾护送汉献帝东归。
description.en: A general in the late Eastern Han Dynasty who once escorted Emperor Xian back to the east.

description.zh-cn: 三国时期蜀汉的开国皇帝。
description.en: The founding emperor of the state of Shu Han during the Three Kingdoms period.

description.zh-cn: 曹操的重要谋士。
description.en: An important advisor to Cao Cao.

description.zh-cn: 曹操的重要谋士。
description.en: An important advisor to Cao Cao.

description.zh-cn: 刘备的义弟，蜀汉名将。
description.en: A sworn brother of Liu Bei and a famous general of Shu Han.

description.zh-cn: 曹操的堂弟，曹魏重要将领。
description.en: A cousin of Cao Cao and an important general of Cao Wei.

description.zh-cn: 三国时期东吴的建立者。
description.en: The founder of the state of Eastern Wu during the Three Kingdoms period.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏的宗室将领。
description.en: A general from the imperial clan of Cao Wei.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏的宗室将领。
description.en: A general from the imperial clan of Cao Wei.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏后期的重要将领。
description.en: An important general in the late Cao Wei period.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏时期的官员。
description.en: An official of the Cao Wei period.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏时期的官员，以刚直著称。
description.en: An official of the Cao Wei period, known for his integrity and uprightness.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏时期的官员、文学家，与曹丕友善。
description.en: An official and writer of the Cao Wei period, and a close friend of Cao Pi.

description.zh-cn: 董昭的弟弟。
description.en: The younger brother of Dong Zhao.

description.zh-cn: 董昭的嗣子。
description.en: The heir of Dong Zhao.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏时期的官员，以清廉正直著称。
description.en: An official of the Cao Wei period, known for his incorruptibility and integrity.

description.zh-cn: 济阴郡下辖县，为董昭的家乡。
description.en: A county under Jiyin Commandery, and the hometown of Dong Zhao.

description.zh-cn: 三国时期由曹丕建立的政权。
description.en: A state founded by Cao Pi during the Three Kingdoms period.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年汉献帝的都城，由曹操控制。
description.en: The capital city during the reign of Emperor Xian in the late Eastern Han Dynasty, controlled by Cao Cao.

description.zh-cn: 荆州北部的军事重镇。
description.en: A key military stronghold in northern Jing Province.

description.zh-cn: 荆州的治所，关羽的后方根据地。
description.en: The administrative center of Jing Province and Guan Yu's rear base.

description.zh-cn: 长江以南的地区。
description.en: The region south of the Yangtze River.

description.zh-cn: 董昭早期曾事奉袁绍，被任命为参军、巨鹿太守、魏郡太守。
description.en: In his early career, Dong Zhao served Yuan Shao and was appointed as Adjutant, Administrator of Julu, and Administrator of Wei.

description.zh-cn: 后因袁绍听信谗言欲加罪于董昭，逼使其逃离。
description.en: Later, because Yuan Shao listened to slander and intended to punish Dong Zhao, Dong Zhao was forced to flee.

description.zh-cn: 离开袁绍后，董昭被河内太守张杨挽留，并被任命为骑都尉。
description.en: After leaving Yuan Shao, Dong Zhao was retained by Zhang Yang, the Administrator of Henei, and appointed as Captain of Cavalry.

description.zh-cn: 董昭在曹操手下长期担任谋臣，历任议郎、冀州牧、徐州牧、司空军祭酒等职，为其出谋划策，深受信赖。
description.en: Dong Zhao served as a long-term advisor under Cao Cao, holding various positions such as Gentleman-consultant, Governor of Ji Province, Governor of Xu Province, and Libationer of the Minister of Works' Army. He provided strategies and was deeply trusted.

description.zh-cn: 曹丕称帝后，董昭继续在曹魏任职，官至将作大匠、大鸿胪、侍中、太常、太仆等。
description.en: After Cao Pi became emperor, Dong Zhao continued to serve in Cao Wei, holding positions such as Grand Master of Works, Grand Herald, Palace Attendant, Grand Master of Ceremonies, and Grand Coachman.

description.zh-cn: 曹叡即位后，董昭进爵乐平侯，历任卫尉，并于232年升任司徒。
description.en: After Cao Rui ascended the throne, Dong Zhao was promoted to Marquis of Leping, served as Commandant of the Guards, and was appointed Minister over the Masses (Situ) in 232.

description.zh-cn: 董昭出生于济阴定陶。
description.en: Dong Zhao was born in Dingtao, Jiyin.

description.zh-cn: 董昭在担任瘿陶县长时，曾接待新任冀州刺史贾琮。
description.en: When Dong Zhao was the Magistrate of Yintao County, he received Jia Cong, the new Inspector of Ji Province.

description.zh-cn: 董昭到任巨鹿太守后，以计谋诛杀了意图作乱的当地大姓孙伉。
description.en: After taking office as the Administrator of Julu, Dong Zhao used a ruse to execute Sun Kang, a member of a prominent local clan who intended to rebel.

description.zh-cn: 献计曹操，通过诱骗杨奉，成功将汉献帝迎至许昌。
description.en: He proposed a plan to Cao Cao to trick Yang Feng, successfully welcoming Emperor Xian of Han to Xuchang.

description.zh-cn: 与程昱、郭嘉等人共同警告曹操，认为派遣刘备攻打袁术必然会导致其叛变，但曹操未采纳。
description.en: Along with Cheng Yu and Guo Jia, he warned Cao Cao that sending Liu Bei to attack Yuan Shu would inevitably lead to his rebellion, but Cao Cao did not heed the advice.

description.zh-cn: 向曹操献计，推动其接受“魏公”的爵位。
description.en: He proposed to Cao Cao, pushing him to accept the title of 'Duke of Wei'.

description.zh-cn: 协助曹操进一步受封为“魏王”。
description.en: He assisted Cao Cao in being further enfeoffed as the 'King of Wei'.

description.zh-cn: 在樊城之战中，建议曹操将与孙权结盟的消息用箭射入城中，以振奋被关羽围困的曹仁守军的士气。
description.en: During the Battle of Fancheng, he suggested that Cao Cao shoot arrows carrying the news of the alliance with Sun Quan into the besieged city to boost the morale of Cao Ren's troops, who were surrounded by Guan Yu.

description.zh-cn: 通过分析判断曹休的部将不会全力作战，其观点影响了曹休进攻江南的计划，使其未能如愿。
description.en: By analyzing that Cao Xiu's subordinate generals would not fight with all their might, his opinion influenced Cao Xiu's plan to attack Jiangnan, preventing it from succeeding as wished.

description.zh-cn: 上书陈述流末之弊，导致诸葛诞、邓飏等人被罢免。
description.en: He submitted a memorial discussing the flaws of focusing on trivial matters, which led to the dismissal of Zhuge Dan, Deng Yang, and others.

description.zh-cn: 上书陈述流末之弊，导致诸葛诞、邓飏等人被罢免。
description.en: He submitted a memorial discussing the flaws of focusing on trivial matters, which led to the dismissal of Zhuge Dan, Deng Yang, and others.

description.zh-cn: 文中提及张邈与袁绍不和。
description.en: The text mentions that Zhang Miao was on bad terms with Yuan Shao.

description.zh-cn: 董昭的弟弟董访在张邈的军中。
description.en: Dong Zhao's younger brother, Dong Fang, was in Zhang Miao's army.

description.zh-cn: 关羽率军围困了曹仁驻守的樊城。
description.en: Guan Yu led his forces to besiege Cao Ren, who was defending Fancheng.

description.zh-cn: 孙权与曹操结盟，同意从后方袭击关羽的根据地江陵。
description.en: Sun Quan formed an alliance with Cao Cao, agreeing to attack Guan Yu's base in Jiangling from the rear.

description.zh-cn: 孙权同意袭击关羽的根据地江陵，破坏了其北伐。
description.en: Sun Quan agreed to attack Guan Yu's base in Jiangling, sabotaging his northern campaign.

description.zh-cn: 苏则与董昭同任侍中时，曾推开枕在其腿上的董昭，并说：“我苏则之膝，不是佞人的枕头。”，表达了对其品行的不屑。
description.en: When Su Ze and Dong Zhao were both Palace Attendants, Su Ze pushed away Dong Zhao who was resting his head on his lap, saying, 'The lap of I, Su Ze, is not a pillow for a sycophant,' expressing his disdain for Dong Zhao's character.

description.zh-cn: 同乡吴质曾向董昭抱怨不被乡人看好，显示了二人之间较为亲近的关系。
description.en: Wu Zhi, who was from the same hometown, once complained to Dong Zhao about not being well-regarded by their fellow townspeople, indicating a relatively close relationship between the two.

description.zh-cn: 董访是董昭的弟弟。
description.en: Dong Fang was the younger brother of Dong Zhao.

description.zh-cn: 董胄是董昭的嗣子。
description.en: Dong Zhou was the heir of Dong Zhao.

description.zh-cn: 司马芝的妻子是董昭的侄女，因此司马芝是董昭的侄女婿。
description.en: Sima Zhi's wife was Dong Zhao's niece, making Sima Zhi his nephew-in-law.

description.zh-cn: 曹丕接受汉献帝的禅让，正式建立曹魏政权，成为开国皇帝。
description.en: Cao Pi accepted the abdication of Emperor Xian of Han and formally established the state of Cao Wei, becoming its founding emperor.
